decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board by using various removal spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through blinking permanents with Yorion, Sky Nomad and utilizing the companion mechanic. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of threats and stabilizing cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Day of Judgment to maintain board presence and protect your life total. With a mana base that focuses on white sources and utility lands, the deck looks to outvalue and outlast opponents in a longer game.

The primary strategy of this Boros Aggro deck is to flood the board with low-cost creatures like Ornithopter and Thraben Inspector, then buff them with cards like Venerated Loxodon and Knight-Errant of Eos to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cosmogrand Zenith and Gleeful Demolition provide removal options, while Needleverge Pathway and Inspiring Vantage ensure consistent mana for aggressive plays. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly with powerful attacks, utilizing a mix of efficient creatures and combat tricks.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells and utilizing Arclight Phoenix to constantly bring it back from the graveyard to the battlefield. It utilizes cheap spells and cantrips to efficiently cast Arclight Phoenix and generate card advantage with Treasure Cruise. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a consistent stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of Hall of Storm Giants provides a powerful finisher option in case the game goes long.

This deck focuses on attacking aggressively with creatures like Screaming Nemesis, Emberheart Challenger, and Manifold Mouse, supported by burn spells like Reckless Rage and Lightning Strike. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick damage output and board presence, utilizing cards like Monstrous Rage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan for additional firepower. The deck also includes utility lands like Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance and Den of the Bugbear to give it an edge in combat. This Red Deck Wins archetype aims to win quickly and decisively in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard multiple times in a single turn. It utilizes cheap card draw spells and removal to control the board while setting up for big swings with Arclight Phoenix. The deck aims to win the game through aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and attacking creatures. It also includes some counterspells and tempo plays to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize graveyard interaction and sacrifice mechanics to generate value and overwhelm opponents with a consistent stream of threats. By combining cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Scavenger's Talent with powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to control the board while continually pressuring the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Grisly Salvage and Dredger's Insight ensures that the deck can efficiently utilize its graveyard as a resource while also maintaining card advantage.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser to generate value and outvalue the opponent. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage, while Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber can help control the board. Overall, this deck aims to control the game and grind out advantages to eventually win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. With a mix of powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, along with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage help to maintain board control and deal additional damage. The inclusion of man lands like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins provide additional threats and reach to close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal consistent damage quickly and efficiently. The deck focuses on using cheap and efficient creatures like Manifold Mouse and Emberheart Challenger, along with powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and keep pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Hazoret the Fervent provide additional reach and finisher potential, ensuring the deck can close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with spells, allowing you to bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks. The deck focuses on using efficient spells like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's ability. Other cards like Artist's Talent and Treasure Cruise help you draw through your deck to find your key pieces. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster and Cori-Steel Cutter adds additional aggressive threats to overwhelm your opponent. By utilizing a combination of spells and creatures, this deck aims to consistently pressure your opponent and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix, while using cheap removal spells and card draw to control the board. The deck aims to be aggressive and efficient, utilizing card selection and burn spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of Picklock Prankster and Cori-Steel Cutter provides additional threat and board presence, allowing for various strategies to be employed in order to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures, efficient removal spells, and disruptive hand disruption. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources while maintaining a strong board presence. Key cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide powerful threats, while cards like Duress and Thoughtseize disrupt the opponent's game plan. Utilizing a combination of burn spells and creature threats, the deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo to overwhelm the opponent. The main strategy involves controlling the board with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while setting up the combo pieces. Seasoned Hallowblade and Sheltered by Ghosts provide protection for key creatures, while Guardian of New Benalia and Monument to Endurance help maintain board presence. Fleeting Spirit and Lively Dirge offer additional support and flexibility in combat situations. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and quickly finish off the opponent with the combo.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures and pump spells to quickly deal damage and pressure their life total. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo, utilizing cards like Venerated Loxodon and Knight of the White Orchid to establish board presence early on, while also having access to removal spells like Gleeful Demolition to deal with threats. By maintaining a fast and aggressive pace, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana with Lotus Field and Thespian's Stage, while using Hidden Strings and Pore Over the Pages to dig for combo pieces. It utilizes various lands and spells to support the combo, protect against disruption, and eventually win the game with powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience. The key idea is to assemble the necessary pieces to generate an overwhelming advantage and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption to clear the way for powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The inclusion of Mutavault and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker allows for additional threats and extra damage, while cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide graveyard interaction and recurring threats. The mana base is constructed to support the Aggro gameplan with a mix of fast lands and dual lands to ensure consistent and explosive starts.
